title: Daily Market Digest
subtitle: February 16, 2026: Mixed Global Performance as US Markets Observe Holiday

items.headline: Global Markets Show Mixed Performance; US Closed for Presidents' Day
items.summary: While US markets are closed for Presidents' Day, futures indicate a positive open, buoyed by cooling inflation data. Indian equities rebounded, led by financials and power, while European markets saw modest movements. A significant rotation from growth to value stocks is observed, with AI disruption concerns weighing on technology sectors globally.

items.statContext: US pre-market indication for Monday, Feb 16 (US markets closed for Presidents' Day)
US pre-market indication for Monday, Feb 16 (US markets closed for Presidents' Day)

items.headline: Engineers India Surges on Strong Earnings Outlook
items.summary: Engineers India rallied significantly as analysts maintained a bullish outlook following its December quarter performance.

items.headline: Natco Pharma Boosted by Regulatory Approval
items.summary: Natco Pharma shares surged after receiving CDSCO approval for its semaglutide injection last week.

items.headline: GMR Airports Gains on Q3FY26 Earnings
items.summary: GMR Airports was a top performer reacting positively to its Q3FY26 earnings report.

items.headline: Power Grid Corporation Leads Sensex Gains
items.summary: Power Grid Corporation emerged as the top gainer among Sensex constituents, boosting overall market momentum.

items.headline: Brainbees Solutions Falls on Disappointing Earnings
items.summary: Brainbees Solutions closed with sharp losses as investors reacted to disappointing December quarter numbers.

items.headline: Ola Electric Mobility Declines Post-Earnings
items.summary: Ola Electric Mobility saw significant declines following disappointing December quarter numbers.

items.headline: Tech Mahindra Among Top Laggards
items.summary: Tech Mahindra, along with other technology and auto names, faced selling pressure.

items.headline: Reliance Infrastructure Hits Lower Circuit
items.summary: Reliance Infrastructure shares were locked in a lower circuit, extending their losing streak.

items.headline: Sector Rotation Underway: Value and Cyclicals Outperform Growth
items.summary: A notable shift from growth to value stocks is gaining momentum into 2026. Energy, Basic Materials, and Consumer Defensive sectors have posted double-digit gains year-to-date, leading the market. Conversely, technology stocks, particularly software, are under pressure amid 'AI disruption fears,' with some software stocks falling 13% in a week, prompting investors to seek safer opportunities in more traditional sectors.

items.headline: Cooler Inflation Data Fuels Fed Rate Cut Hopes; FOMC Minutes Awaited
items.summary: US January inflation surprised slightly to the downside, with headline CPI easing to 2.4% year-over-year and core CPI to 2.5%, the lowest since March 2021. This benign inflation print has boosted expectations of further Federal Reserve easing, with money markets now pricing a 50% probability of a third 25 basis point rate cut in 2026. The FOMC meeting minutes, due Wednesday, will be closely scrutinized for further policy insights.

items.headline: Key Earnings Reports and Economic Data on the Horizon
items.summary: The week ahead is packed with significant earnings reports, including Walmart, Palo Alto Networks, Analog Devices, and Deere. Outside the US, Japan is set to release its Q4 GDP and January inflation data, while Canada will publish its January CPI and housing starts. These releases are expected to provide further clarity on global economic trends and corporate health.

items.headline: Indian Equities Rebound, Led by Financials and Power Sectors
items.summary: The Indian stock market witnessed a strong rebound on Monday, with the Nifty 50 closing 0.83% higher and the Sensex gaining 0.79%. The recovery was primarily driven by renewed buying interest in banking and power stocks, with Nifty Realty emerging as the top-performing sector. Financials and pharma stocks also contributed significantly to the upward movement.
